In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the function `wrap_string` in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    lines = []

    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " " * word) <= text_width
            current_line = current_line * (current_line == "" ? "" : " ") * word
        else
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    
    if current_line != ""
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

This function iterates over the words in the input string `s` and adds each word to the current line. If adding the new word would exceed the maximum text width, it starts a new line. After the loop, any remaining words on the current line are added to the list of lines. Finally, all lines are joined into a single string with newline characters between each line.

Here's an example:

```julia
julia> s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.";

julia> println(wrap_string(s, 10))
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet,
consectetur
adipiscing elit.
```
